struct.name: AsyncActionProgress
struct.description: Records the progress of an asynchronous action.

structMember.name: actionName
structMember.description: Name of the invoked asynchronous action.

structMember.name: additionalInfo
structMember.description: Used for logging significant messages during execution of an action.

structMember.name: progressInfo
structMember.description: Textual information that describes the actual state of the action execution.

structMember.name: progressPercentage
structMember.description: Progress of the action. The range is between 0 and 100.

structMember.name: result
structMember.description: Result state of a completed action. This field has value NOT_AVAILABLE if the action is not finished.

structMember.name: resultInfo
structMember.description: Textual description of the outcome/result of the action containing useful information for the NMS. If the action failed, it can contain an error message.

structMember.name: state
structMember.description: Current state of the action.

structMember.name: actionId
structMember.description: Uniquely identifies the invocation of an action. Identifies the invocation of an action when the managed object allows invocation of more than one action at a time.

structMember.name: timeActionStarted
structMember.description: Date and time when the current action was started.

structMember.name: timeActionCompleted
structMember.description: Date and time when the action was completed (successfully or unsuccessfully).

structMember.name: timeOfLastStatusUpdate
structMember.description: Date and time when the struct member state was last updated.

struct.name: CertificateContent
struct.description: The content of the X.509 certificate.

structMember.name: version
structMember.description: The version of the encoded certificate.

structMember.name: serialNumber
structMember.description: The serial number of the certificate assigned by the CA.

structMember.name: signatureAlgorithm
structMember.description: The identifier for the algorithm and hash function used by the CA in signing the certificate.

structMember.name: issuer
structMember.description: The X.501 distinguished name of the CA that signed and issued the certificate.

structMember.name: validFrom
structMember.description: The certificate is valid from this date.

structMember.name: validTo
structMember.description: The certificate is valid to this date.

structMember.name: publicKey
structMember.description: Carries the public key.

structMember.name: publicKeyAlgorithm
structMember.description: Identifies the algorithm of which this public key is an instance.

structMember.name: keyUsage
structMember.description: The usage category for which the certificate was issued as defined by X.509 key usage extension.

structMember.name: extensionContent
structMember.description:
Contains the X.509 certificate extensions.
An extension string is displayed in Field:Value format.

structMember.name: subject
structMember.description: The X.501 distinguished name of the subject associated with the public-key.

enum.name: KeyInfo
enum.description:
Indicates the key type and length in bits.
This enumeration supports Rivest Shamir Adleman (RSA) and Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA).

enumMember.name: RSA_1024
enumMember.description: 1024-bit long key generated for the RSA algorithm.

enumMember.name: RSA_2048
enumMember.description: 2048-bit long key generated for the RSA algorithm.

enumMember.name: RSA_3072
enumMember.description: 3072-bit long key generated for the RSA algorithm.

enumMember.name: RSA_4096
enumMember.description: 4096-bit long key generated for the RSA algorithm.

enumMember.name: ECDSA_160
enumMember.description: ECDSA algorithm with P-160 curve.

enumMember.name: ECDSA_224
enumMember.description: ECDSA algorithm with P-224 curve.

enumMember.name: ECDSA_256
enumMember.description: ECDSA algorithm with P-256 curve.

enumMember.name: ECDSA_384
enumMember.description: ECDSA algorithm with P-384 curve.

enumMember.name: ECDSA_512
enumMember.description: ECDSA algorithm with P-512 curve.

enumMember.name: ECDSA_521
enumMember.description: ECDSA algorithm with P-521 curve.

enumMember.name: ECDSA_BRAINPOOL_256
enumMember.description: ECDSA algorithm with Brainpool P-256 r1 curve.

enumMember.name: ECDSA_BRAINPOOL_320
enumMember.description: ECDSA algorithm with Brainpool P-320 r1 curve.

enumMember.name: ECDSA_BRAINPOOL_384
enumMember.description: ECDSA algorithm with Brainpool P-384 r1 curve.

enumMember.name: ECDSA_BRAINPOOL_512
enumMember.description: ECDSA algorithm with Brainpool P-512 r1 curve.

enumMember.name: ECDSA_SECP_256_R1
enumMember.description: ECDSA algorithm with SECP 256 r1 curve.

enumMember.name: ECDSA_SECP_384_R1
enumMember.description: ECDSA algorithm with SECP 384 r1 curve.

enumMember.name: ECDSA_SECP_521_R1
enumMember.description: ECDSA algorithm with SECP 521 r1 curve.

enumMember.name: NOT_VALID_YET
enumMember.description: Based on the validFrom date, the certificate is not yet valid.

enumMember.name: VALID
enumMember.description: Based on the validFrom and validTo dates, the certificate is valid.

enumMember.name: EXPIRED
enumMember.description: Based on the validTo date having passed, the certificate expired.

enumMember.name: REVOKED
enumMember.description: The certificate was revoked by a trusted CA.

enumMember.name: CANCELLING
enumMember.description: Cancellation is in progress.

enumMember.name: RUNNING
enumMember.description: The execution of the action is currently in progress.

enumMember.name: FINISHED
enumMember.description: The action is finished.

enumMember.name: CANCELLED
enumMember.description: The action has been cancelled and cancellation has been done.

enum.name: FingerprintSupport
enum.description: The SHA fingerprint algorithm the ME supports.

enumMember.name: SHA_1
enumMember.description: The SHA-1 secure hash algorithm.

enumMember.name: SHA_224
enumMember.description: The SHA-224 secure hash algorithm.

enumMember.name: SHA_256
enumMember.description: The SHA-256 secure hash algorithm.

enumMember.name: SHA_384
enumMember.description: The SHA-384 secure hash algorithm.

enumMember.name: SHA_512
enumMember.description: The SHA-512 secure hash algorithm.

enum.name: AuthorityType
enum.description:
Enrollment authority types.
This type is deprecated.

enumMember.name: CERTIFICATION_AUTHORITY
enumMember.description: An entity that issues certificates.

enumMember.name: REGISTRATION_AUTHORITY
enumMember.description:
An intermediate PKI entity, separate from the Certification Authority.
Used for registration purposes and certificate enrollment.

enumMember.name: MANUAL
enumMember.description:
Certificate renewal is manually performed by the MS.
This renewal mode requires the MS to start an enrollment by manually invoking one of the enrollment actions.

enumMember.name: AUTOMATIC
enumMember.description: Certificate renewal is automatically performed by the ME.

enumMember.name: SCEP
enumMember.description: Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol.

enumMember.name: CMP
enumMember.description: Certificate Management Protocol.

enum.name: ManagedCertificateState
enum.description: The states the MS may set for a certificate.

enumMember.name: ENABLED
enumMember.description: The certificate is enabled.

enumMember.name: DISABLED
enumMember.description: The certificate is disabled.

enum.name: FeatureState
enum.description: Indicates whether a feature is Activated or Deactivated.

enumMember.name: ACTIVATED
enumMember.description: The feature is administratively activated.

enumMember.name: DEACTIVATED
enumMember.description: The feature is administratively deactivated.

enum.name: ActionResultType
enum.description: Lists the different results of an action.

enumMember.name: SUCCESS
enumMember.description: The asynchronous action ended with success.

enumMember.name: FAILURE
enumMember.description: The asynchronous action ended with failure.

enumMember.name: NOT_AVAILABLE
enumMember.description: No result is available yet.

enumMember.name: OFFLINE_CSR
enumMember.description:
Certificate Signing Request-based (CSR) offline enrollment.
The certificate for a node credential is manually provided by the MS using a CSR in PKCS#10 format.

enumMember.name: OFFLINE_PKCS12
enumMember.description:
PKCS#12-based offline enrollment.
The node credential is manually provided by the MS using a PKCS#12 format, a certificate accompanied by a private key.

enumMember.name: ONLINE_SCEP
enumMember.description: Online enrollment. The node credential is acquired by the Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol.

enumMember.name: ONLINE_CMP
enumMember.description: Online enrollment. The node credential is acquired by the Certificate Management Protocol.

derivedDataType.name: DateTime
derivedDataType.description:
Represents the international standard for the representation of date and time ( ISO 8601). The string format is "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ" (excluding quotes). A DateTime string consists of a date part, a time part, and an optional time zone information part. The time zone part may be a "Z", representing the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone (equals to +00) or a time zone offset (for example, +02:00). If the time zone part is not present, the DateTime value represents local time.
The following pattern describes the DateTime format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.S+][Z|+-hh:mm] Where: YYYY = Four digit year MM = Two digit month (01=January, and so on) DD = Two digit day of month (01 through 31) T = Time designator (shows start of time component) hh = Two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = Two digits of minute (00 through 59) ss = Two digits of second (00 through 59, leap second not allowed) S+ = One or more digits of decimal fraction of a second Z = Time is UTC +- = + or - character indicating positive or negative offset to UTC
DateTime values are compliant with ISO 8601 "Representation of dates and times" but are restricted according to RFC 3339 "Date and Time on the Internet: Timestamps". The DateTime format is further restricted as follows: - T and Z designators are upper case. - . (dot) is used to indicate start of fractions of seconds (ISO 8601 also allows comma)

derivedDataType.name: Fingerprint
derivedDataType.description:
A derived string type that allows hexadecimal digits.
The string must be entered in two-digit groups separated by colons. For example: b7:a8:c6:d5:43:fa:50:43

derivedDataType.name: ExpiryAlarmThresholdRange
derivedDataType.description: Range in days for certificate expiry alarm threshold.

derivedDataType.name: DistinguishedName
derivedDataType.description:
Represents the international standard for the representation of Distinguished Name (RFC 4517). The DistinguishedName syntax is defined in RFC4517. The string representation of the Distinguished Name structure is as follows:
distinguishedName = [ relativeDistinguishedName ( COMMA relativeDistinguishedName ) ] relativeDistinguishedName = attributeTypeAndValue ( PLUS attributeTypeAndValue ) attributeTypeAndValue = attributeType EQUALS attributeValue attributeType = descr/numericoid attributeValue = string/hexstring

class.name: CertM
class.description:
The top class of the Certificate Management model.
Certificate management encompasses management of node credentials and trusted certificates.

action.name: installTrustedCertFromUri
action.description:
Installs a trusted certificate from the specified Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).
The action can be invoked if no other action in progress on this MO. The action returns immediately after invocation. The progress of the action can be tracked via the reportProgress attribute.
The action returns with TRUE after successful invocation, otherwise it returns with FALSE.
The generic URI syntax is defined by RFC 3986. Example: sftp://myuser@myhostname.ericsson.local/dir/subdir/certificate Example: http://myhostname.ericsson.local/dir/subdir/certificate

parameter.name: uri
parameter.description:
This parameter contains a URI assumed to point to the certificate file.
The generic URI syntax is defined by RFC 3986. Example: sftp://myuser@myhostname.ericsson.local/dir/subdir/certificate The URI must not contain any password. The password shall be provided in the second parameter of this action.

parameter.name: uriPassword
parameter.description:
The password section of the URI.
If a password is not required, the 'NULL' string must be provided.

parameter.name: fingerprint
parameter.description:
The Secure Hash Algorithm (SHA) fingerprint of the certificate to be installed.
The fingerprint is checked against the fingerprint calculated on the installed file. If fingerprint verification is not required, the 'NULL' string has to be provided. The hash must be calculated by the SHA algorithm indicated in fingerprintSupport of the CertMCapabilities MO.

action.name: cancel
action.description:
Cancels an ongoing action on this MO.
Can be invoked during execution of an action.

action.name: downloadCrl
action.description:
Downloads the Certificate Revocation List (CRL) files.
CRLs are downloaded from Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) locations indicated by the CRL distribution points extension of the peer certificates at the time specified by the extension. This action allows the MS to trigger a download in the special case when CRLs are published prior to the published update times.
The action can be invoked if no other action is in progress on this MO and returns immediately after invocation. The progress of the action can be tracked via the reportProgress attribute.
The action returns with TRUE after successful invocation, otherwise it returns with FALSE.
action.disturbances: Downloading new CRLs can cause loss of traffic if newly downloaded CRLs contain revocations of trusted certificates used for TLS or IPsec.

parameter.name: trustedCert
parameter.description: The DN of the TrustedCertificate MO to be removed.

attribute.name: certMId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: An additional descriptive text.

attribute.name: reportProgress
attribute.description: Reports the progress of the ongoing action on this MO.

attribute.name: localFileStorePath
attribute.description:
Contains a file sytem path for locally stored certificates.
The default directory path on the ME file system where certificates or credential containers are stored. It may store locally generated files or files generated after push download.

attribute.name: activeVendorCredential
attribute.description:
Indicates the active vendor credential for initial enrollments.
Contains the DN of a VendorCredential MO.

attribute.name: trustedCertificateId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedByCategory
attribute.description:
Indicates the trust categories this trusted certificate belongs to.
Contains the Distinguished Names of the TrustCategory Managed Objects.

attribute.name: managedState
attribute.description:
The state of the trusted certificate set by the MS.
If set to ENABLED, the certificate is trusted and the state of the certificate is represented by certificateState. If set to DISABLED, the trusted certificate is quarantined, and thus the trust relationship is suspended.
attribute.disturbances: Disabling a trusted certificate which is used for TLS or IPsec can cause loss of traffic.

attribute.name: certificateContent
attribute.description: The X.509 content of the certificate.

attribute.name: certificateState
attribute.description: The current state of the certificate.

class.name: NodeCredential
class.description: Represents the node credential and contains information about the corresponding certificate.

action.name: cancelEnrollment
action.description:
Cancels the enrollment process.
If the enrollment runs in online polling mode, this action stops polling the enrollment server. The enrollment rejects to confirm the PKI response from the enrollment server and releases the generated key-pair. The enrollment fails.

action.name: startOnlineEnrollment
action.description:
Starts the online enrollment process.
For initial enrollment when a vendor credential is not available, a challengePassword must be provided, otherwise the vendor credential or the existing valid node credential signs the PKI request.
If the enrollmentSupport attribute of the CertMCapabilities MO indicates that online enrollment is supported, the action can be invoked.
As inputs, the action uses subjectName, keyInfo, enrollmentServerGroup and enrollmentAuthority attributes.
If no other action is in progress on this MO, the action can be invoked and it returns immediately after invocation. Action progress can be tracked via the enrollmentProgress attribute.
The action returns with TRUE after successful invocation, otherwise it returns with FALSE.

parameter.name: challengePassword
parameter.description: The one-time challenge password used as a shared-secret between the ME and the enrollment CA.

action.name: startOfflineCsrEnrollment
action.description:
Starts a manual enrollment procedure.
Creates a PKCS#10 Certificate Signing Request (CSR) that is stored at the specified local Uniform Resource Identifier URI. A file transfer service can be used to fetch the CSR file from the ME.
The action can be invoked if the enrollmentSupport attribute of the CertMCapabilities MO indicates that offline CSR-based enrollment is supported.
The action uses attributes subjectName and keyInfo attributes as inputs.
If no other action is in progress on this MO, the action can be invoked and it returns immediately after invocation. The action progress can be tracked via the enrollmentProgress attribute.
The action returns with TRUE after successful invocation, otherwise it returns with FALSE.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.description:
This parameter contains a URI assumed to point to the certificate or credential container file.
The generic Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) syntax is defined by RFC 3986. Example: sftp://myuser@myhostname.ericsson.local/dir/subdir/file The URI must not contain any password. The password shall be provided in the second parameter of this action.

parameter.name: uriPassword
parameter.description:
The password section of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).
If a password is not required, the 'NULL' string must be provided.

action.name: installCredentialFromUri
action.description:
Installs a node credential or certificate from the specified Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).
If the container file is in PKCS#12 format, the action implicitly starts an offline enrollment. If the file is a certificate in Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM) or Distinguished Encoding Rules (DER) format, this action closes the ongoing offline enrollment process started by the startOfflineCsrEnrollment action.
Chain certificates are imported from PEM formatted file or PKCS#12 container file.
The action can be invoked if the enrollmentSupport attribute of the CertMCapabilities MO indicates that offline enrollment is supported.
For a container file in PKCS#12 format, the action can be invoked if there is no other action in progress on this MO. For a certificate file in PEM or DER format, the action can be invoked if there is a startOfflineCsrEnrollment action in progress on this MO.
The action returns immediately after invocation. The progress of the action can be tracked via the enrollmentProgress attribute.
The action returns with TRUE after successful invocation, otherwise it returns with FALSE.
The generic URI syntax is defined by RFC 3986. Example: sftp://myuser@myhostname.ericsson.local/dir/subdir/certificate Example: http://myhostname.ericsson.local/dir/subdir/certificate

parameter.name: uri
parameter.description:
This parameter contains a URI assumed to point to the certificate or credential container file.
The generic Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) syntax is defined by RFC 3986. Example: sftp://myuser@myhostname.ericsson.local/dir/subdir/file The URI must not contain any password. The password shall be provided in the second parameter of this action.

parameter.name: uriPassword
parameter.description:
The password part of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).
If a password is not required, the 'NULL' string has to be provided.

parameter.name: credentialPassword
parameter.description:
The password for decrypting the PKCS#12 container file.
If the action is called to install a certificate in Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM) or Distinguished Encoding Rules (DER) format to finish a running enolment process, the value of password has to be 'NULL'.

parameter.name: fingerprint
parameter.description:
The Secure Hash Algorithm (SHA) fingerprint of the certificate to be installed.
The fingerprint is checked against the fingerprint calculated on the installed file. If the verification of the fingerprint is not required, the 'NULL' string must be provided. The hash must be calculated by the SHA algorithm indicated in fingerprintSupport of the CertMCapabilities MO.

attribute.name: nodeCredentialId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: An additional descriptive text.

attribute.name: subjectName
attribute.description:
The X.501 DN to be used in the subject field of the requested certificate.
For instance: "C=SE,O=Ericsson,CN=someserialnumber.ericsson.com"

attribute.name: reservedByUser
attribute.description:
Indicates the users of this NodeCredential MO.
The users are identified by Distinguished Names of Credential User Managed Objects.

attribute.name: enrollmentTimer
attribute.description:
The enrollment poll timer in minutes.
If the time indicated by this timer elapses before the enrollment is finished, the enrollment fails. Used only for online enrollment.

attribute.name: enrollmentServerGroup
attribute.description: The DN of the EnrollmentServerGroup used for online enrollments.

attribute.name: keyInfo
attribute.description:
Specifies the key type and length that is used for the next enrollment.
Deprecated key types are not recommended for new enrollments.
For the supported key types see CertMCapabilities MO keySupport attribute.

attribute.name: enrollmentProgress
attribute.description: Reports the progress of the ongoing enrollment.

attribute.name: renewalMode
attribute.description:
The certificate renewal mode for online enrollment.
If configured to AUTOMATIC, renewal will be performed automatic when the node certificate date is about to expire.
If an automatic enrollment failed alarm is present on the MO, setting this attribute to MANUAL clears the alarm.

attribute.name: enrollmentAuthority
attribute.description: The DN of the EnrollmentAuthority used for online enrollments.

attribute.name: expiryAlarmThreshold
attribute.description:
Threshold value to calculate the date of the alarm indicating the coming expiry of the certificate.
The alarm severity is raised to MINOR in case the remaining time to expiry is reduced to the one third of the configured threshold. The alarm severity is raised to MAJOR in case the remaining time to expiry is reduced to the one tenth of the configured threshold or one week. The alarm is cleared and a certificate not available alarm is raised when the certificate expires.

attribute.name: subjectAltName
attribute.description: The subjectAltName can be specified either as an IP address or a FQDN. Format is <type>:<value> where: type is either IP (for IP address) or DNS (for FQDN) and value is: An IPv4 address in dotted decimal notation. An IPv6 address in colon decimal notation An FQDN In case a type identification (IP or DNS) is not present, the type will be interpreted depending on value. Examples: someserialnumber.ericsson.com DNS:someserialnumber.ericsson.com IP:145.34.23.123 IP:2001:DB8::8:800:200C:417A

attribute.name: certificateContent
attribute.description: The X.509 content of the certificate.

attribute.name: certificateState
attribute.description: The current state of the certificate.

class.name: VendorCredential
class.description: Represents the vendor credential pre-installed on the ME.

attribute.name: vendorCredentialId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: certificateContent
attribute.description: The X.509 content of the certificate.

attribute.name: certificateState
attribute.description: The current state of the certificate.

class.name: EnrollmentServerGroup
class.description: Maintains a group of enrollment servers for load balancing.

attribute.name: enrollmentServerGroupId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: An additional descriptive text.

class.name: EnrollmentAuthority
class.description: Represents a Certification or Registration Authority for certificate enrollment.

attribute.name: enrollmentAuthorityId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: enrollmentCaCertificate
attribute.description:
The trusted cerificate of the RA or CA used for enrollment authentication.
Represents the certificate by the DN of the appropriate TrustedCertificate MO.
The RA or CA certificate provided in the PKI response is authenticated by this trusted certificate.
If this attribute has any value, the attribute enrollmentCaFingerprint is ignored.

attribute.name: enrollmentCaFingerprint
attribute.description:
The SHA fingerprint of the trusted cerificate of the RA or CA used for enrollment authentication.
If the trusted certificate is not stored on the ME as a TrustedCertificate MO, the enrollmentCaCertificate attribute cannot refer to the appropriate TrustedCertificate MO, so this attribute at least must be provided. If enrollmentCaCertificate references a TrustedCertificate MO, this attribute displays the fingerprint of the certificate defined by enrollmentCaCertificate, and cannot be modified.
The fingerprint of the trusted certificate provided by the PKI response is calculated and compared to this attribute. If a match is found, the certificate is used for authenticating the CA or RA.
The hash must be calculated by the Secure Hash Algorithm (SHA) algorithm indicated in fingerprintSupport of the CertMCapabilities MO.

attribute.name: authorityType
attribute.description:
Indicates the type of the enrollment authority.
Used for the verification of the Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) response message. In case of a Certification Authority (CA), the self-signed certificate of the CA is accepted by ME given that the certificate is configured either in attribute enrollmentCaCertificate or enrollmentCaFingerprint. In case of a Registration Authority (RA), the RA certificate is verified using the CA certificate of the RA configured in attribute enrollmentCaCertificate.
This entity is deprecated as implemented redundant functionality.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: An additional descriptive text.

attribute.name: enrollmentAuthorityName
attribute.description:
Specifies the name of the issuing CA.
The X.501 distinguished name of the issuing CA used for addressing and reference identity.

class.name: TrustCategory
class.description: Represents a group of trusted certificates that can be referenced by Credential Users on the ME.

attribute.name: trustCategoryId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: An additional descriptive text.

attribute.name: trustedCertificates
attribute.description:
The list of trusted certificates that belongs to this trust category.
Contains the Distinguished Names of the TrustedCertificate Managed Objects.

attribute.name: reservedByUser
attribute.description:
Indicates the users of this TrustCategory MO.
The users are identified by Distinguished Names of Credential User Managed Objects.

attribute.name: crlCheck
attribute.description:
Toggles CRL control.
Toggles CRL control for the certificates validated in the chain of a trusted certificate in this TrustCategory MO. If ACTIVATED, CRLs are checked. If DEACTVATED, CRLs are not checked.
attribute.disturbances: Activating CRL check can cause loss of traffic if CRLs contain revocations of trusted certificates used for TLS or IPsec.

class.name: CertMCapabilities
class.description: Contains the certificate management capabilities of the ME.

attribute.name: certMCapabilitiesId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: enrollmentSupport
attribute.description: Indicates the enrollment methods supported by the ME.

attribute.name: fingerprintSupport
attribute.description:
The secure hash algorithm the ME supports for fingerprint calculation.
The attributes and parameters in the CertM model taking a fingerprint must be provided by calculating the fingerprint using the indicated algorithm.

attribute.name: keySupport
attribute.description: List of the key types the ME supports.

class.name: EnrollmentServer
class.description:
Represents an enrollment server.
An enrollment server implement the Certificate Management Protocol (CMP).

attribute.name: enrollmentServerId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: An additional descriptive text.

attribute.name: enrollmentAuthority
attribute.description:
The Certification Authority or Registration Authority used by this enrollment server.
Represents the enrollment authority by the DN of the EnrollmentAuthority MO.
This entity is deprecated. If this attribute is specified, the enrollmentAuthority attribute in the NodeCredential MO referring to the EnrollmentServerGroup MO of this EnrollmentServer MO is ignored.
attribute.statusInformation: Deprecated in version 2.0. Function replaced by enrollmentAuthority attribute in NodeCredential MOC.

attribute.name: uri
attribute.description:
The URI of the enrollment server.
The URI consists of a protocol, an IP or DNS address and an optional port number. Specify the optional port designation by appending a colon followed by the port number to the host part, for example, 192.168.33.27:8080. If no port number is provided, the default port is used.
Example for CMP: http://192.168.33.27:8080 or cmp://192.168.33.27

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: The enrollment protocol.

class.name: ChainCertificate
class.description: Chain certificate belonging to the credential.

attribute.name: chainCertificateId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: certificateContent
attribute.description: The X.509 content of the certificate.

attribute.name: certificateState
attribute.description: The current state of the certificate.
